name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Hell yeah! Cheaper drug prices are out, private prisons are in! Wooo, America’s back baby! And if you don’t like it, you can go suck and egg. But FYI, the price of eggs is up 38 percent.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: I mean, fix it yourself, Oklahoma! You had plenty of warning from the song. ‘Oklahoma, where the wind comes sweeping down the plain/and you fix it yourself.'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: The only time you hear the word FEMA in Massachusetts is when a guy named Murph breaks his leg drunk sledding.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: What do you mean you’ll take a look? They’re all out! You’ll be looking at an empty jail cell.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: This guy ran on stopping violent crime and one of his first acts was releasing felons convicted of violent crime. The message is clear, if you support Trump violence is forgiven. If MS-13 had changed their name to Los Amigos de los Trumpas, they would have been on the dais at the inauguration.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: All right, first you’re complaining that it was boring? It’s church! You want the bishop to dance to ‘Ave Maria’ with a katana in her hand?

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: On Trump’s response to calls for mercy and compassion] “This is like holding up a Rorschach test and the patient immediately says, ‘Oh, I know this one. It’s a guy violently strangling another guy and then cutting him up and eating him.’ And you say,’Well, most people say butterfly.'

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: Yeah, you hear that! Don’t you even think about doing DEI in secret, all right? Don’t be meeting up in back alleys like, ‘Yo, you got any lesbian resumés for me today?'

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: That’s right, Donald Trump went back in time to kill baby DEI.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: Trump is doing deep dives into these obscure government policies like he’s DEI John Oliver .

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: And I’m not going to pretend to know more about civil rights law than Donald Trump—he’s been sued over it many times.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: Whoa, whoa, whoa, what does the Constitution have to do with this? The Constitution is for gun stuff.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: This judge has been judging for four decades and has never seen something so blatantly unconstitutional. I mean, that’s the judge equivalent of a Kendrick diss track. All the other judges were like, ‘Ohhhhh sh*****t, we concur!'

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: This is like if you took a pregnancy test and it said, ‘You are the least pregnant anyone’s ever been in 40 years.'

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: You did that. Like three days ago!

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: He was cheating in order to look better at online gaming. Which is sort of like embezzling money so you can buy yourself a racecar bed.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: I’d love to tell you more about this story, but I started reading about this game called Path of Exile II and the article mentioned something about account boosting and I just felt my virginity growing back.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: Very cool. I did not realize that the moon had farmers markets now.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: I think this app could go even further. I’d love a dating app that just jumped straight to restraining order.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: A 19-year-old woman’s breast size quadrupled after getting the Covid vaccine. The worst part is now she’s more likely to catch Covid because of all the mens’ heavy breathing.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: All of those shows are imagineered by CBS television chemists to be the kind of edgy procedural thrillers that Pop-Pop can still follow after the beta blockers kick in.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: That’s right, FBI:CIA in NYC. Starring Ice-T’s New York cousin, Long Island Ice-T.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: My only quibble here is that I’m not sure New York City needs more law enforcement, fictional or otherwise. There are already five cops watching me swipe into the subway. Why? I’m 60! There’s already a system in place to prevent me from jumping the turnstile, and it’s not the FBI—it’s the ACL.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: I cannot wait for all the inter-agency action. ‘FBI, this is CIA, you’re MIA.’ ‘I’m on the FDR from JFK. ‘WTF? ETA?’ ‘TBD. ASAP. Latest, EOD.’ ‘UOK?’ ‘TBD, IDK.’ ‘Y?’ ‘I had a G and T, gotta pee-pee, LOL, BRB.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: He described Trump’s order as ‘blatantly unconstitutional.’ And judges rarely talk that bluntly. Except in the landmark case, Marbury v. You Gotta Be Yankin’ My Chain .

A text you received on January fifth reading, and I quote, ‘A-Boooooiiiing!’ And that text was sent to you by Representative… me.'

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It’s the first time in history that a natural disaster will be visited by an even bigger natural disaster.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: On one hand, you might think, ‘Oh wow, what a—only a despicable human being would use disaster relief money as a bargaining chip.’ But on the other hand—there is no other hand, it’s just that hand.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: [On Trump appearing to blame an endangered fish for the wildfires during a Fox News interview] “Great point, Jacques-Off Cousteau.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: For 262 days, this city has been drier than Kanye’s eyes at a screening of Schindler’s List .

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Which is very L.A.—we’ve already moved onto a younger, hotter fire.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: If you haven’t seen it, it’s basically a musical about if Caitlyn Jenner ran a drug cartel.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: He’s up for his role in The Apprentice , where he plays the Donald Trump Melania wishes she was married to.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: There’s no question we’ve had a devastating month. But we’re slowly getting back to doing what we do best, which is giving awards to movies no one has ever heard of or seen.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: In other words, get ready for a whole year of numbskulls trying to convince us that Nancy Pelosi pooped in her own desk.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: We know who is responsible for January 6. He’s in the Oval Office right now playing whac-a-mole with his Diet Coke button.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: They’ll probably make it a holiday. From now on, January 6 will be known as National Patriotic Parkour Day.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It’s like putting the Hamburglar in charge of finding out who stole all the Big Macs.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Trump spoke to a forum in Switzerland and then he signed an executive order changing the name of Swiss cheese to The Cheese of America.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: In his speech, Trump said that the last 72 hours have been ‘nothing less than a revolution in common sense.’ While everyone at the meeting was like, ‘Oh my god, it’s only been 72 hours?'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: People heard and were like, Yes! A movie that we’ve actually seen!

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: I’m Still Here was nominated for Best Picture. It’s the story of Joe Biden’s last six months in office.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: On Sebastian Stan getting a Best Actor nod for playing Donald Trump in The Apprentice ] “You can tell Sebastian’s still in character because he’s already telling people he won.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Starbucks is training employees on how to de-escalate conflict with people who want to use the bathroom without buying anything. Yeah that’s who I want to engage with, an angry stranger that desperately needs the bathroom.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Starbucks employees were like, ‘Minimum wage, no healthcare, and I get to be the bathroom cop? Awesome!'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Spirit Airlines updated their policy on appropriate attire and said that passengers can be kicked off a flight if they’re barefoot, have improper clothing, or offensive tattoos. But if you have all three they’ll let you fly the plane.
